snippet: The Fenimore Art Museum in Cooperstown, N.Y., has acquired an ornate folk-art shoeshine box that was displayed at the Museum of Modern Art in the 1940s.
abstract: Fenimore Art Museum in Cooperstown, NY, purchases fanciful 1930s shoeshine stand created by Italian immigrant bootblack Giovanni Indelicato after stand emerges from obscurity in Point Pleasant, NJ, where maker's granddaughter was holding it; piece disappeared after being exhibited at Museum of Modern Art in 1940s.
lead_paragraph: The Fenimore Art Museum in Cooperstown, N.Y., has acquired an ornate folk-art shoeshine box that was displayed at the Museum of Modern Art in the 1940s.

headline.main: A Shoeshine Box, With a Luster All Its Own, Emerges From the Shadows
headline.print_headline: A Shoeshine Box, With a Luster All Its Own, Emerges From the Shadows
